channel.title: Devblogs.microsoft.com on .NET Ramblings
channel.description: Recent content in Devblogs.microsoft.com on .NET Ramblings

item.title: Now in Public Preview: Azure Functions Trigger for Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB vCore
item.description: The Azure Cosmos DB trigger for Azure Functions is now in public preview‚Äîavailable for C# Azure Functions using Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB vCore! This new capability allows developers to easily trigger Azure Functions in response to changes in a MongoDB vCore collection, making it simple to build real-time, event-driven applications with minimal setup. üîç [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/now-in-public-preview-azure-functions-trigger-for-azure-cosmos-db-for-mongodb-vcore

item.title: How can I detect if one of my helper processes is launching child processes?
item.description: You can ask a job object to keep track for you. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20250523-00/?p=111216

item.title: Durable Functions for Indexing in RAG: A Practical Python Approach
item.description: Azure Durable Functions streamline RAG indexing by combining push flexibility with pull reliability for scalable, Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/ise/durable-functions-for-rag-indexing

item.title: Office Add-ins announces Copilot agents with add-in actions and more at Build 2025
item.description: As part of the expanding capabilities for agents across Microsoft 365, Office Platform announces add-in actions for Copilot agents are available in preview. This blog is an overview of all the new capabilities across the platform: APIs, developer tools, and add-in distribution options‚Äîmaking it simpler to build new or iterate on JavaScript add-ins. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/microsoft365dev/office-addins-at-build-2025

item.title: Now Available: Migrate from RU to vCore for Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB via Azure Portal
item.description: We are thrilled to introduce a cost-effective, simple, and efficient solution for migrating from RU-based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB to vCore-based. You can now move to vCore-based Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB at no cost using the Azure portal.¬†How is the vCore model different?¬†Azure Cosmos DB offers two pricing models: Request Units [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/migrate-mongo-db-ru-to-vcore

item.title: New AI Features in SQL Server 2025
item.description: We have some great new AI Features in SQL Server 2025. I also figured a video would be better than reading a blog‚Ä¶. but, you can also read all about it here. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sql/new-ai-features-in-sql-server-2025

item.title: Generally Available: Seamless Migration from Serverless to Provisioned Throughput in Azure Cosmos DB
item.description: We are excited to announce the general availability (GA) of a highly requested capability in Azure Cosmos DB: the ability to migrate from serverless to provisioned throughput mode‚Äîwithout manual recreation, or downtime. This release builds on the momentum of our public preview and is now fully supported across all regions. Why it matters Azure Cosmos [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/generally-available-seamless-migration-from-serverless-to-provisioned-throughput-in-azure-cosmos-db

item.title: Public Preview: Shape and Control Workloads with Throughput Buckets in Azure Cosmos DB
item.description: Imagine your application is processing customer checkouts in real-time, while a background process synchronizes data for reporting. Suddenly, the seamless user experience falters because the sync job consumes more RU/s than anticipated.¬†Many teams face a common challenge: multiple workloads share the same container resources, yet each has different performance requirements.¬†We‚Äôre excited to introduce [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/public-preview-shape-and-control-workloads-with-throughput-buckets-in-azure-cosmos-db

item.title: Introducing the Agent Store: Build, publish, and discover agents in Microsoft 365 Copilot
item.description: We‚Äôre excited to introduce the Agent Store ‚Äî a centralized, curated marketplace that features agents built by Microsoft, trusted partners, and customers. The Agent Store offers a new, immersive experience within Microsoft 365 Copilot that enables users to browse, install, and try agents tailored to their needs. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/microsoft365dev/introducing-the-agent-store-build-publish-and-discover-agents-in-microsoft-365-copilot

item.title: Announcing TypeScript Native Previews
item.description: This past March we unveiled our efforts to port the TypeScript compiler and toolset to native code. This port has achieved a 10x speed-up on most projects ‚Äì not just by using a natively-compiled language (Go), but also through using shared memory parallelism and concurrency where we can benefit. Since then, we have made several [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/typescript/announcing-typescript-native-previews

item.title: Microsoft Entra ID integration with Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB (vCore)
item.description: Security is no longer a nice-to-have‚Äîit‚Äôs a foundational requirement for any cloud-native architecture. As organizations adopt managed database services to support mission-critical applications, they must prioritize robust, scalable, and centralized security. Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB (vCore) delivers high performance and flexibility, but it provides the most value when paired with well-implemented security practices. Authentication [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/microsoft-entra-id-integration-with-azure-cosmos-db-for-mongodb-vcore

item.title: How can I create a window the size of the screen without it being treated as a fullscreen window?
item.description: You can declare that you aren't rude. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20250522-00/?p=111211

item.title: Foundry Local: A New Era of Edge AI
item.description: At Microsoft Build 2025, Microsoft unveiled its groundbreaking¬†Foundry Local¬†solution for edge devices‚Äîan efficient platform specifically designed for local AI inference. As a critical component of Microsoft‚Äôs AI strategy, Foundry Local empowers developers to smoothly deploy and run Small Language Models (SLMs) on resource-constrained edge devices, opening new possibilities for the convergence of edge computing and [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/foundry/foundry-local-a-new-era-of-edge-ai

item.title: DiskANN and Filtered Vector Search are Now Generally Available in Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB (vCore)
item.description: We‚Äôre excited to announce general availability of DiskANN and Filtered Vector Search on Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB (vCore), starting with M30 cluster tiers and above. You can now use these features in production to store and query vector embeddings directly alongside your operational data‚Äîefficiently and in one integrated vector database.¬†DiskANN Indexing: Scaling Vector [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/diskann-in-azure-cosmos-db-for-mongodb

item.title: Connect Once, Integrate Anywhere with MCP
item.description: In the fast-paced world of AI development, connecting intelligent applications to the tools and data sources they need can be challenging. That‚Äôs why Model Context Protocol (MCP) is resonating with some many, an open standard that‚Äôs transforming how developers integrate AI capabilities into their applications. MCP enables you to ‚Äúconnect once, integrate anywhere‚Äù by creating [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/blog/connect-once-integrate-anywhere-with-mcps

item.title: AI and Vector Data Extensions are now Generally Available (GA)
item.description: We‚Äôre excited to announce that these extensions are now generally available, providing developers with a robust foundation to build scalable, maintainable, and interoperable AI-powered applications. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/ai-vector-data-dotnet-extensions-ga

item.title: MSSQL Extension for VS Code: Introducing Schema Designer (Preview)
item.description: Overview Database design can often feel like navigating a maze of tables, relationships, and data types ‚Äî especially when working directly with T-SQL scripts. But what if you could map out your database, make changes to your tables, and manage complex schemas within a graphical interface? We are excited to announce the Public Preview of [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sql/vs-code-mssql-schema-designer

item.title: Connecting to Private NuGet Feeds Just Got Easier
item.description: The Visual Studio 2022 17.14 update is here, and it brings great quality-of-life improvements‚Äîespecially around NuGet authentication. From context about the authentication needs of private NuGet feeds to a simplified account selection workflow, this update helps you stay focused on your code! If you haven‚Äôt already, download the latest Visual Studio update to take advantage [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/connecting-to-private-nuget-feeds-just-got-easier

item.title: AI Shell Preview 4 Release!
item.description: We're excited to share the latest preview release of AI Shell that includes new features and improvements based on your feedback. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/powershell/preview-4-ai-shell

item.title: Now in Preview: Azure Cosmos DB Fleets
item.description: We‚Äôre excited to announce the preview of Azure Cosmos DB fleets. Azure Cosmos DB fleets address common challenges that developers face when building and managing multi-tenant or Software as a Service (SaaS) applications. Today, many SaaS providers using Azure Cosmos DB isolate each tenant in a separate database account to meet strict performance and security [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/now-in-preview-azure-cosmos-db-fleets

item.title: Semantic Kernel and Microsoft.Extensions.AI: Better Together, Part 1
item.description: This is the start of a series highlighting the integration between Microsoft Semantic Kernel and Microsoft.Extensions.AI. Future parts will provide detailed examples of using Semantic Kernel with Microsoft.Extensions.AI abstractions.¬†The most common questions are:¬†‚ÄúDo Microsoft‚Äôs AI extensions replace Semantic Kernel?‚Äù¬†‚ÄúWhen should I use Microsoft‚Äôs AI extensions instead of Semantic Kernel?‚Äù¬†This blog post [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/semantic-kernel/semantic-kernel-and-microsoft-extensions-ai-better-together-part-1

item.title: Transitioning to new Extensions AI IEmbeddingGenerator interface
item.description: As Semantic Kernel shifts its foundational abstractions to Microsoft.Extensions.AI, we are obsoleting and moving away from our experimental embeddings interfaces to the new standardized abstractions that provide a more consistent and powerful way to work with AI services across the .NET ecosystem. The Evolution of Embedding Generation in Semantic Kernel Semantic Kernel has always aimed [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/semantic-kernel/transitioning-to-new-iembeddinggenerator-interface

item.title: Azure MCP Server ‚Äì May 2025 Release
item.description: This post discusses the updates to the Azure MCP (Model Context Protocol) Server for Microsoft //build 2025. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sdk/azure-mcp-server-may-2025-release

item.title: Introducing the Microsoft 365 Agents Toolkit
item.description: Read how the Microsoft 365 Agents Toolkit, an evolution of Microsoft Teams Toolkit, is designed to help developers build agents and apps for Microsoft 365 Copilot, Microsoft Teams, and Microsoft 365. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/microsoft365dev/introducing-the-microsoft-365-agents-toolkit

item.title: Azure DevOps with GitHub Repositories ‚Äì Your path to Agentic AI
item.description: GitHub Copilot has evolved beyond a coding assistant in the IDE into an agentic teammate ‚Äì providing actionable feedback on pull requests, fixing bugs and implementing new features, creating pull requests and responding to feedback, and much more. These new capabilities will transform every aspect of the software development lifecycle, as we are already seeing [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/blog/azure-devops-with-github-repositories-your-path-to-agentic-ai

item.title: Announcing Azure Command Launcher for Java
item.description: Optimizing JVM Configuration for Azure Deployments Tuning the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) for cloud deployments is notoriously challenging. Over 30% of developers tend to deploy Java workloads with no JVM configuration at all, therefore relying on the default settings of the HotSpot JVM. The default settings in OpenJDK are intentionally conservative, designed to work across [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/java/announcing-azure-command-launcher-for-java

item.title: Why does Windows report my processor speed twice, with slightly different values?
item.description: One is calculated. The other is self-promotion. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20250520-00/?p=111201

item.title: Agent mode for every developer
item.description: At the beginning of April, agent mode rolled out to all users in Visual Studio Code. Since then, we‚Äôve seen and heard how developers are embracing this tool and using it to transform their workflows. Now, just six weeks later, we‚Äôre excited to announce that it‚Äôs available to all developers using VS Code, Visual Studio, [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/blog/agent-mode-for-every-developer

item.title: .NET Aspire 9.3 is here and enhanced with GitHub Copilot!

Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/introducing-dotnet-aspire-93

item.title: Accelerate Your .NET Upgrades with GitHub Copilot
item.description: Upgrade your .NET apps with confidence! Introducing our newest AI-powered upgrade experience, GitHub Copilot app modernization - Upgrade for .NET. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/github-copilot-upgrade-dotnet

item.title: Announcing the General Availability (GA) of JSON data type & JSON aggregates‚Ä¶
item.description: We are excited to announce the General Availability (GA) of the native JSON data type and JSON aggregates ‚Äì JSON_OBJECTAGG & JSON_ARRAYAGG. You can use the JSON data type and JSON aggregates to integrate and work with JSON documents more efficiently in the database. This functionality is available in Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Managed [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sql/announcing-the-general-availability-ga-of-json-data-type-json-aggregates

item.title: Vibe coding with GitHub Copilot: Agent mode and MCP support in JetBrains and Eclipse
item.description: Today, we‚Äôre excited to announce that GitHub Copilot Agent Mode and MCP support are now in public preview for both JetBrains¬†and Eclipse! Whether you‚Äôre working in IntelliJ IDEA, PyCharm, WebStorm or Eclipse, you can now access Copilot‚Äôs intelligent agent features and seamlessly manage your project workflows, all from within your IDE.¬†In this post, we‚Äôll [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/java/vibe-coding-with-github-copilot-agent-mode-and-mcp-support-in-jetbrains-and-eclipse

item.title: GitHub Copilot: Exploring Agent Mode and MCP Support in Public Preview for Xcode
item.description: We‚Äôre excited to announce that GitHub Copilot‚Äôs Agent Mode and Model Context Protocol (MCP) support are now available in public preview for Xcode! This brings powerful autonomous coding capabilities to macOS developers using Xcode. What is Agent Mode? Agent Mode turns GitHub Copilot into an intelligent pair programmer that can understand your intent, plan multi-step [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xcode/github-copilot-exploring-agent-mode-and-mcp-support-in-public-preview-for-xcode

item.title: Unlocking the Power of Regex in SQL Server
item.description: Regular expressions, or regex, are powerful tools for text manipulation and pattern matching. They are incredibly useful in various scenarios, such as data validation, extraction, and transformation. SQL Server 2025 introduces native support for regex functions, making it easier to perform complex text operations directly within SQL queries. This Regex support is available in SQL [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sql/unlocking-the-power-of-regex-in-sql-server

item.title: Edit is now open source
item.description: What is Edit? Edit is a new command-line text editor in Windows. Edit is open source, so you can build the code or install the latest version from GitHub! This CLI text editor will be available to preview in the Windows Insider Program in the coming months. After that, it will ship as part of [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/commandline/edit-is-now-open-source

item.title: Accelerating MongoDB Development on Azure: What‚Äôs New at Microsoft Build 2025
item.description: Microsoft Build 2025 is underway in Seattle, bringing developers together to shape the future of cloud-native app development. If you build MongoDB workloads in Azure, this year‚Äôs updates give you even more tools to accelerate development. We‚Äôve streamlined how you build and modernize MongoDB applications in the cloud with our managed service- vCore-based Azure Cosmos [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/accelerating-mongodb-development-on-azure-whats-new-at-microsoft-build-2025

item.title: Supercharge AI development with new AI-powered features in Microsoft Dev Box
item.description: AI is reshaping how we build, deploy, and scale software. As more apps become AI-powered, developers need environments that can keep up with speed and demands of innovation. We‚Äôve heard from customers just how critical it is to have a zero-config experience when building AI applications, with streamlined access to compute, prebuilt models, and environment [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/develop-from-the-cloud/supercharge-ai-development-with-new-ai-powered-features-in-microsoft-dev-box

item.title: How to Watch Microsoft Build 2025 Online

These changes focus on improving maintainability, aligning with the latest APIs, and ensuring a consistent experience for users. Below you‚Äôll find details on package graduations, deprecations, and a [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/semantic-kernel/semantic-kernel-package-previews-graduations-deprecations
